channel.title: Object Placing
channel.description:
Ok on my rsps I put in objects and compiled i logged in and they go through the wall not sideways :S i need help please...
here is pic
[img]http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/148/serverpicthroughwall.jpg/[/img]

item.title: Object Placing
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(411, 3095, 3500, 0, 10);
411 = ObjectID
3095 = X Coordinate
3500 = Y Coordinate
0 = Object Face
10 = Object Type

Read full topic

item.title: Object Placing
item.dc:creator: @Resent Resent
item.description:
@Resent wrote:

[quote=“iiLovePVP, post:1, topic:412500”]Ok on my rsps I put in objects and compiled i logged in and they go through the wall not sideways :S
i need help please…

here is pic

link of pic if it dont come up:
http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/148/serverpicthroughwall.jpg/[/quote]

-Go into your source folder and look up “ObjectManager.java”

-Find the ID of the object that you’re having issues with.

-You’re going to see a code like this: c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(411, 3095, 3500, 0, 10); The fourth number, in this case is a “0”, represents the direction that your object is facing.
0=West
-1=North
-2=East
-3=South

Change that number until the object is placed in the proper position, and make sure you put a negative sign before every number except “0.”

Read full topic
